Description: Heavily corroded iron artefact in the shape of a poker; made of a flat, narrow, straight bar, widening and tapering at one end like a spatula, and bent at the other to form a kind of flattened loop-pommel.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, "Qasr", east annex (C), chamber 19 A
Curator's comments: One of the three "pokers of the type of that from Naukratis", found in Chamber 19A with the knife BM 23942, mentioned by W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p.56 § 55, p. 78 § 78, p. 110, pl. xxxviii, 12.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p.56 § 55, p. 78 § 78, p. 110, pl. xxxviii, 12)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.46, p.74, p.76, p.184, pl.26)
Condition: Corroded, broken into three pieces rejoined
